Fields.DialogueText: Kaga, we need to talk about our plan.
Plan, Kanchou? I don't really do plans.

Fields.MenuText: What if they get the drop on you?
Well, if Command seems to like it...
There's more to a war than that.

Fields.DialogueText: Then it's not our problem anymore, is it?
So thankful you're starting to catch up.
Not if you do it right!
What's the word from Command on my modifications, anyway?
What!? You said they'd signed off on my recommendations!
I said they were interested in hearing more.
They think your theories are sound. And there's a novelty to it as well... we humans aren't used to hearing input from our ships on their construction.
Get used to it.
Believe me, we're working on it. They just want some after action reports from you personally regarding the order of battle and what could be done to improve.
We talk strategy all the time.
Chigau! We talk technique all the time. I prescribe the same strategy for each encounter: bomb anything that moves and then coup de grace anything that keeps moving.
There isn't one.
What haven't I told them?
Paperwork? Me!? Kanchou, are you sure this isn't just your way of foisting your duties on me?
I'm learning that I couldn't foist anything on you if I tried. This is just the quickest way to the next stage of your evolution.
Evolution, hmm? Well, when you put it like that... Fine. I suppose I can deal with a little pencil pushing.
I'm glad.
Right up these Funayūrei-
Action stations!
@BATTLE
Here.
What's this?
The after action report from our last tussle with the Funayūrei.
Well, everything looks in order. Your strokes are surprisingly clean.
What's that supposed to mean?
... Nothing. They're very... precise.
Ha! When you boil the sea around your enemy, you don't need precision.
I'm starting to see that. The characters get more erratic as I flip through, until... oh, good grief.
I got bored.

Fields.MenuText: I can't send this to Command. This is a joke.
Well, it's certainly... unique.
I didn't think you bored easily.

Fields.DialogueText: It's evocative, Kanchou! The whole problem with Command is that they're not here to see these battles happen.
Aren't I always?
Neither did I. But unless I'm playing cards I'm rarely in one place long enough to check.
Kaga, your after-action report dissolves into a charcoal drawing of a Morgana in flames.
I really tried to capture her ugliness. It's not my favored medium.
Fire. If I grip the charcoal tightly and close my eyes, I can almost see the battle if I just believe.
You're lucky I did my own version. Stay on task after this next fight?
@BATTLE
Out of curiosity, what is?
Those philistines at Command wouldn't know high art if it strafed them.
Kanchou, I wanted to apologize for my behavior the other day.
About the after action report?
I let my work suffer because of my frustration with Command. Their bureaucracy, and their slavish devotion to procedure, not to mention their-

Fields.MenuText: They've got a job to do and they're doing it.
Really taking the sincerity out of your apology there.
I don't disagree with you.

Fields.DialogueText: When you put it like that, well, I'm not sure I was wrong... but perhaps I understand better.
I'm getting off topic. Here's my point, Kanchou.
Could have fooled me sometimes, Kanchou.
My success is the Empire's success. And if that means a little... paperwork... to reach my full potential... I'm willing to take on that challenge.
Good. The faster you can demonstrate to Command what needs doing, the faster it'll get done.
I'd give my life for the Empire. Why not a little time that I could be using to shore up my armor? Or... remodel my planes, or my fuel tanks, or...
Do you need to blow something up?
Let's. Before I talk myself into regretting this.
@BATTLE
You keep bringing up your bombers in the after action reports. I thought you'd decided they were perfect.
Help me understand why you believe less armor is better. Let's start there.
I'm sure you've heard me before, but I'll gladly say it again....

Fields.MenuText: Perhaps with a bit less superiority this time?
Sarcasm noted. Please continue.
Forgive us poor humans, Kaga.

Fields.DialogueText: Heard and discarded. I wouldn't get on your case for telling me how your hands work.
Sky remains blue, Asia remains Japan's destiny. Moving on!
Don't beg, Kanchou, it's unbecoming.
You were saying?
Some of the primary benefits of less armor include higher flight and greater fuel conservation.
And with fuel as life, pilots may like that more.
Additionally, they can fly higher and avoid anti-aircraft fire.
But better fuel consumption won't protect them from fighters.
That's why we have our fighters.
Who will get shot down at the first exchange with enemy fighters.
Not if they have a height advantage. It's easier to dive than climb, and fighters with less armor and more fuel can escort longer.
I'll forward this to Command. I think you make some decent points.
@BATTLE
They're essential, Kanchou. That doesn't make them infallible. All the more reason to keep them under scrutiny!
I know I do. Wouldn't it be easier if you just deferred to my authority on the subject?
Probably, but that's not the world we live in.
*ALARM*
Shame. Well, the world changes. Let's keep one step ahead of it.
Kaga, I've been giving your more-fuel-less-armor idea some consideration.
Watashi wa sore o kī te ureshi. What do you think? Brilliant? Lifesaving? Revolutionary, even?

Fields.MenuText: Let's not get ahead of ourselves.
How could I not have found them as such?
Deadly and humble. How did I ever live without you....

Fields.DialogueText: Let's assume you admit my brilliance and move forward.
Well, maybe not revolutionary. It's common sense.
Sarcasm's like bombing, Kanchou. Devastating and best left to me.
Noted.
But not agreed?
Kaga....
Hai, hai, hai, it goes without saying. I'm glad you've been taking this seriously, Kanchou. It'd be a crying shame if we had all the tools we needed and didn't use them.
Understood, Kaga. I fear for our pilots as well as every other man on this ship and in this fleet. That's why we need to get this right: to make our superiors understand the need as well as we do.
On that I think we can agree. Well, just about.
Just about?
@BATTLE
Fear can go jump in something slimy. That alarm's getting to be music to my ears...
*ALARM*
Kaga, you said something about not thinking you'd be taken seriously.
By bureaucrats and stuffed shirts. You're one of the good ones, Kanchou.
I'll let that slide. But keep in mind we're building the war around you Belles. In the grand scheme of things, I'm just along for the ride.
We are the grand scheme of things. That includes you as my kanchou. Without us, the Empire would either collapse under the Funayūrei or become a colony of some other nation.
And still may if we don't set the proper course. I won't say the Empire and every other nation's survival depends on us. I'm not that self-centered.
You could stand to be a little more self-centered.

Fields.MenuText: Your words, not mine.
I doubt the fleet would survive our personalities clashing that way.
Be careful what you wish for.

Fields.DialogueText: Keep them. They're a gift.
That sounds like their problem.
Oh, I never invoke anything I can't banish.
Well, if you're really worried about being taken seriously, don't be. You take it as a challenge, and I know what you do with challenges.
Turn them into smoking husks of slag.
Maybe you should put those artistic skills to use on some propaganda.
Oh, don't tempt me, Captain. I wasn't even trying on that last drawing.
Here comes some more inspiration...
@BATTLE
Just give me something to draw!
Kanchou, we're needed on the bridge! Funayūrei have been spotted at....
Kaga, have you been smoking again?
Never mind my smoking. We need to light up some Funayūrei!
The bridge crew can handle themselves in the initial stages. Back to my question, though. Have you been smoking again?
Have I ever stopped?

Fields.MenuText: Why couldn't you stop?
Don't you see what that does to you?
Can you at least do it somewhere other than the engine room?

Fields.DialogueText: It takes the edge off and Belles heal quicker than humans do. It'd be irresponsible of me not to smoke.
Literally nothing? I suppose so.
But I never have to ask for a light down here!
In a bizarre way, it's a pure advantage for you. But you've got more moving parts than a simple battleship...
Which has to be the first time one of those has been called simple.
...so we need to make sure we keep any and all ash out of our grease areas.
If that's the only problem, I can deal with that. The smoke will remain, but I can ensure no ash will escape my notice.
How?
We Kami have our mysterious ways.
So be it. Please go let the bridge know I'm on my way.
@BATTLE
I've worked up the numbers you asked for, Kanchou. Let's get these to Command.
Hold on there, Kaga. I need to look over them first to make sure our superiors can understand everything contained therein.
Our superiors?
Surely you aren't implying my superiors aren't yours as well?
I always viewed their rules as... guidelines, to tell you the truth.

Fields.MenuText: You do recognize the importance of the Naval Protection Force, don't you?
Are you saying you serve the Emperor only?
Everyone's got bureaucrats to kowtow to. Even Belles.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course I do. I'm in the Naval Protection Force.
Well, not only. Just mostly.
I'm abundantly aware, Kanchou. It drives me to smoke.
It's just a formality, but they like their formalities in Zurich. Those in power are loath to lose it. Let me see your work?
It should prove beyond a shadow of a doubt that I was right all along.
It's comprehensive, too. This is almost as long as that brief you prepared for me before.
Longer. I wrote smaller so as not to waste paper.
You never struck me as a conservationist.
Needs must, Kanchou. I was out of rolling paper.
You're not serious.
Yeah, I was surprised too. I'm going to have to requisition more next time around.
Whatever keeps you sharp, I guess.
Maybe I can make a cigarette case out of one of these Funayūrei...
@BATTLE
Kaga, I went over those numbers you supplied me. Frankly, I'm not sure this is something we can even do with our own bombers, let alone every other one in service.
I never said anything about this being easy.
I hear what you're saying. I just don't know how it can be done.
I mathed it out already. We can let the engineers focus on that and devote ourselves elsewhere.
And where would that be?
Towards the political implications. You said those in power were loath to lose it. I say we focus our time on fast-tracking the proposal and let the engineers do their work.

Fields.MenuText: Efficient. I like it.
I doubt this will work. But I trust you, so I agree.
Aren't we undermining their authority this way?

Fields.DialogueText: I'll work out schedules for the flight engineers. We can keep this going around the clock if we need to.
Command's interested as long as the numbers work out. Where's the harm?
They won't care as long as the numbers add up. Why not deploy the solution quicker when we know it'll be approved?
Good, good. We'll focus ourselves on...
*ALARM*
Very well. Kaga, you know your assignment. Get to it when possible.
Watch and learn, Kanchou. After this battle our air tactics will never be the same. We'll send the current ones out in a blaze of glory!
@BATTLE
Any luck with the engineers, Kaga?
It's slower than I'd like, but they'll pick up once they get used to it.
How much time do you think they'll need?
As much as they take.
Touchy, Kaga?
Nervous. I know this will work. Something inside me says I've walked this road before.
I've been meaning to speak to you about this.
About what?

Fields.MenuText: Your intuition that this should work.
How you've been driven toward this end since you appeared here.
This ability of yours to talk on things you shouldn't know.

Fields.DialogueText: It's more than an intuition in some ways. Have I been speaking like that this whole time?
I'm not sure how to respond to that. Have I been speaking like that this whole time?
That sounds demonic, Kanchou. Have I been speaking like that this whole time?
Not around everyone, mind you. Only me, in fact.
Perhaps it's because I'm comfortable with you?
Or it has something to do with me being the captain. Either way, it's something worth exploring.
Hang on, I think I hear something.
*ALARM*
Time to do our duty.
@BATTLE
Talk to the lookouts about theirs. My senses are still quicker than they are...
So about these strange feelings of yours....
I've been giving it some thought as well. The best I can think is that I just look for patterns, like any good pilot would.
That so?
Maybe. You know how pilots look for weather patterns to get a feel for their flights? Well, I think what I do is something like that. I just know that flying higher and faster is safer.
Yes, and most pilots I've spoken to prefer more firepower and armor to greater speed.
That's because they aren't seeing the big picture.

Fields.MenuText: And you are?
You have the sight to see it?
And out of all the people in the Empire, you alone can?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm a Nagano no Kami. Can't help it.
I believe so, but it's always possible I'm wrong. However improbable.
No one I know sees it better.
And where would we be without you?
Decorating the bottom of the South China Sea. Unless I detect sarcasm, Kanchou?
Think as you wish, Kami, think as you wish.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Quickly.
Kanchou, word from the engineers. They think we can feasibly get the results from the overhauls I recommended.
Excellent!
No celebrating yet, though. The bad news is that creating a working prototype will take twice as long as we'd hoped.
Any idea what the holdup is?
Pure time. Between all the battles, the flight engineers are working nonstop to keep things in working order. Pulling even one mechanic off the maintenance line could prove deadly.
If time is all they need, can't you think of a solution?
You have something in mind, Kanchou?
I believe I'm looking at her.
What, me?

Fields.MenuText: Do you think you're too good to get your hands dirty?
It's unconventional, I know, but I can't imagine anyone better.
If you have a better plan, now's the time to speak up.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm too good not to! They'd be lost  at sea without my guidance.
It's not unheard of! I know of plenty of Kami who work alongside their crew.
No, Kanchou, I think you're right. I think my presence alone would boost productivity.
@BATTLE
Think it over. We've got Morganas.
Between this and the after action reports... I won't have time to be bored. You're all right, Kanchou!
We've made some progress, Kanchou.
Of the good kind, I assume?
Two steps forward, one back... but at least we're walking. It's just...
Just what?
Well, we're always working on at least a handful of my bombers. In shifts, so they're constantly being upgraded.
So what's the problem?
It's just been so long since I brought them all to bear at once...

Fields.MenuText: You can stand to have your overwhelming force be a little less overwhelming now and again.
Patience, Kaga. Think of it as cocking your fist for a stronger punch.
I doubt the Morganas can tell the difference between 85 and 90 bombers' worth of ordnance.

Fields.DialogueText: It feels like having one hand tied behind my back! No... maybe a finger. But it still hurts!
You know, it's almost bearable when you put it that way.
I can, Kanchou! It's like an exploding hangnail...
My sympathies. I bet you wish I could feel as you do.
Kesshite. I'd never wish this on you. It's like having different parts of your body fall asleep around the clock.
Never stopped me before.
But if your foot falls asleep... isn't that uncomfortable to walk on?
Sure. Nothing's changed but how I perceive it.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
I could probably argue with you on physiological grounds.
Not right before a battle, I'd wager.
And thank the heavens for that. I know which I'd prefer.
About that progress....
Ah, yes. So we made some progress in reworking a decommissioned D3A1's fuel tanks and internal struts such that...
Boil it down, Lady Kaga.
I'm trying to if you'd just... wait, did you just call me Lady Kaga?
Seems that I did. I apologize, it was a slip of the tongue.
No, I don't mind... I just wondered, why now?

Fields.MenuText: It was an accident, nothing more.
Don't read too far into it.
It just seemed appropriate, that's all.

Fields.DialogueText: A happy accident.
Too late. You gave a girl a reason.
As well it should have! You're finally learning your place.
Now who's being sarcastic?
Not I. You'd know. Anyway, we modified....
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Action stations! Your lady commands it!
I've just awakened a sleeping giant...
Lady Kaga?
Kanchou.
Hmm... I'm not sure that fits just yet.
It should fit. You've had that name all your life, haven't you?
Not that. I mean you using it.
But why not? I think I've earned the right to speak with you freely.
Yes, but...
Even a kanchou needs to be able to relax, yes?

Fields.MenuText: Yes, but not like this.
Yes, you're right... but don't get too used to it just yet.
No, a captain is always on duty. You could learn from me.

Fields.DialogueText: Noted, Kanchou. But don't think I'll forget who you really are.
I won't, but you should expect to hear it from me again someday.
I do learn, honestly I do. When it's useful.
Now that that's settled...
A moment, please. I'm liking the Lady Kaga part. Why did you use it again?
I just wanted to see what you'd do with it. That, and the engineering team tells me they need a break from you for a few hours.
A break? How dare they! I work twice as hard as any of them!
No, they love working with you. They just wish you'd tone down the smoking.
This again? I already told you I'm keeping it clean.
Specifically, the mid-maintenance smoking.
@BATTLE
Jōdandesho. Do you have any idea how many bombers we've upgraded? It's second nature by now! I've got to stay sharp.
You work on the planes in the hangar decks. Think of the vapors building up down there.
Hard not to when you're surrounded by them.
*ALARM*
Looks like we're out of time. I'm going to have to insist.
I'll just work the crew twice as hard. The quicker I can get back to our new normal, the better.
I understand you're nearing a breakthrough on the mechanical front?
I believe so. I won't bore you with the details of the increase in service ceiling or maximum range, but let's just say you'll be pleased.
I should hope so. Have we considered a test flight?
I can't make one of those. You know that.
I wasn't referring to you. I meant one of my senior pilots.
But Kanchou, I'm not sure if everything... that is... we haven't tested the engines and landing gear and...
Yet you say you're almost ready? Don't get ahead of yourself. You're ready when you're ready.
Is this... are you agreeing with me, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: Take it as you will, Kaga.
Of course not. Just giving you some friendly advice.
Absolutely. Underpromise and overdeliver.

Fields.DialogueText: I take it as a concern, Kanchou. Did you hit your head or something?
Almost too friendly...
I don't under- anything, Kanchou. I'll make this happen if we have to push these birds from the nest!
As I said, don't get ahead of yourself.
I understand, Kanchou. I'll get back to work and let you know when I'm prepared.
Thank you.
@BATTLE
Grr... assuming these Funayūrei give us an ounce of peace.
Kaga, can I ask a question?
Besides that one?
Funny. I've been thinking over your relationship with the ship itself and how you relate to the Amagi....
Amagi.
Indeed. You see, what I'm having trouble understanding is how you know about the Amagi when you didn't appear until several years later.
That's a good question.
And?
It's complicated.

Fields.MenuText: That's it? It's complicated?
Try me.
I'm sorry. I just can't understand how she figures into your experience.

Fields.DialogueText: Kami and humans work differently, of course. Our ancestry's not as cut and dried as yours.
Careful what you wish for.
And I'm getting awful tired of you poking around in my head.
Well, be that as it may, it's something I can't just drop. There's more to your connection to the Amagi than-
Just "Amagi," Kanchou.
@BATTLE
What do you mean? She never-
Awakened. She never got to. The earthquake saw to that. But she was still Amagi. Still my... my...
Your-
Urusai! I'd rather subject the Funayūrei to my wrath right now.
Kanchou, I'd like to officially report that we're ready for a preliminary flight.
Good. Meet me in an hour so I can introduce you to the pilot assigned to this flight.
Pilot? Why?
Because if you're going to send a man into harm's way, you should do him the honor of looking him in the eyes and assuring him you've done everything you can. So have you?
Have I what?
Done everything you can to ensure his safety?
I'd bet my life on it, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: Considering how difficult you would be to kill, that's not very reassuring.
Your life? Good enough for me.
Interesting choice of words, but acceptable.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll die of shame if this doesn't work. Does that count?
If it's good enough for me, it should be.
Better that I bet your life on it? I think not.
Very well. With that, we'll...
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Looks like we're moving the experiment up a bit.
That's the spirit!
That was a magnificent flight, Lady Kaga!
Thank you, Kanchou. I haven't smiled this wide since... well... ever!
A perfect success; brilliant work. The pilot wants to make that his permanent plane, and I'm inclined to let him.
I'm blushing, Kanchou. I never blush.
Well, now, while you've been working on your end, I've been preparing for mine. I've drawn up a set of communications to send to the Imperial Navy for their review.
Do you think they'll pay attention?
I'm lending it my entire weight, Lady Kaga. If I have anything to say about it, they'll listen.
I'm so happy right now, I could just... I could... oh....

Fields.MenuText: Contain yourself, Kaga.
Let it out, Lady Kaga! You deserve a celebration.
Remember the crew, Kaga.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm trying, I'm trying!
Oh, I just feel like I could pop!
A round of sake for them on me! All 1,700 of them!
Just bring it down a touch, all right?
I'm just so excited, I....
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
If Angry Kaga can burn a Morgana to the waterline, I can't wait to see what Joyful Kaga can do...
Any word yet, Kanchou?
Patience, Kaga, patience.
I just don't understand what's taking them so long!
Not everyone is as intelligent as you. Have patience for us poor humans.
Poor humans, ha! You humans have all the breaks.
What do you mean?
Can you imagine what it's like to be able to see our planes fly while knowing you'll never be able to be in one of them in the air?
And when the men get shore leave, can you imagine what it's like to see them off but not travel with them?
No.
As I said, you humans get all the breaks.

Fields.MenuText: Yes, we love getting shot and not being able to instantly heal.
Yes, growing old and dying is such a wonderful concept.
Yes, we love being able to appear and disappear at will.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, not a shot to the hull, of course.
Okay, I guess when you put it that way...
It can't be that hard once you figure it out.
Things aren't so bad as a Kami.
You said it, not me.
More's the pity.
So you're unique.
... I never followed up on what I meant before. About Amagi.
You don't have to.
She's my sister... kind of. Once they decided I should be a carrier, they remade me in a class of my own.
And yet not. And there's something special about being one of a kind.
But I still get... feelings. A sense of how she'd go about things. It's not quite advice, but I don't want to let it go either.
@BATTLE
Can you hear her now?
Well, if I could, she'd probably say... "Blast those fake Kami off the waves."
Good enough for me.

"If it should happen
That we never met again,
I would not complain..."

"And I doubt that she or I
Would feel that we were left alone."
Kanchou! You know the Ogura Hyakunin Isshu?
Some of them. I'm just as surprised you do.
Well, don't be. It's kind of my thing.

Fields.MenuText: I thought that was smoking.
I thought that was bombing Morganas.
Why's that?

Fields.DialogueText: In the same way that enjoying a fine meal can be a thing, I suppose.
Anyone can do that, though not as well as me. It's not who I am, strictly speaking.
It's a long story.
The truth is... well, it's not MY thing. I win all my cigarettes with my unsun karuta deck.
DON'T SAY THAT!
... Gomen nasai. She's not gone. She never will be.
I think a lot of humans could sympathize.
Not the same way, Kanchou. But I get what you mean. I appreciate it.
Looks like we'll have to cut this short. For what it's worth... I think Amagi would be proud.
Thanks, Kanchou. I know she would be. Sometimes I think she tells me herself.
@BATTLE
The poems are from the uta-garuta deck. That was Amagi's thing. Or would have been.
I suppose it doesn't hurt that uta-garuta is a competitive sport in is own right.
It's just something I do for luck.
I see. It's something you can hold on to so she isn't really gone.
I understand. As long as you keep her in your heart-
No, really! I told you about how I get feelings sometimes, when I'm unsure. And when I go by those feelings... she points me in the right direction.
Kaga?
I'm sulking.
Why?
Because the people at Command are idiots, that's why.
Just give them time, Kaga.
How much time do they need? They've already had...
Remember, we humans need time. We need food, we need sleep, we need...
Cigarettes.
Some do.
No, me. I need cigarettes. If I don't get something soon, I swear I'm going to...

Fields.MenuText: Sink like an American collier?
Explode like a German airship?
Disappear like an English luxury liner?

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou! Don't even think about comparing me to those hulks.
Oh, the humanity!
Oh, ha ha. If you can't even find your ships, you won't miss a few colonies.
Made you laugh, didn't I?
Kanchou, I... oh my, yes you did.
Took your mind off things for a moment, didn't it?
It did.
Good, then it was worth it.
@BATTLE
Nice palate cleanser, Kanchou. Now let's eat some Funayūrei alive...
Lady Kaga, I believe a small toast is in order.
It is? Why, is the war over?
No. This latest batch of reports from Command indicates your modification methods are being taken under advisement.
Under advisement? That sounds like they'll be ignoring it!
They will do as they will do. But regardless of Command's decision, we have been given permission to modify our bombers in the described manner.
Meaning...
Meaning we won, Kaga. We can officially start operating with the modifications we've been making.
Finally! Do you know how tedious these after action reports have been?

Fields.MenuText: As I've said before, we all have our orders.
We would have served the Emperor either way.
You've had to backdate them all, haven't you? I didn't think of that.

Fields.DialogueText: However monotonous. If you'd had to write them as if we were operating with older equipment...
I'd give my life for him... but sometimes I wish he'd fill these things out. Maybe if I left them in front of the Imperial Portrait...
Like hell you didn't!
All this time I've had to word them so it sounded like we hadn't gotten started on the upgrades. So... much... proofreading...
@BATTLE
Do you really need to ask?
Think of this as a vacation, Kaga. What would you do on a vacation?
*ALARM*
Know any more poetry, Kaga?
Other than the Ogura Hyakunin Isshu? A bit.
Tennyson's Charge of the Light Brigade. Are you familiar with that one?
'Half a league, half a league, half a league onward?'
That's the one. 'Theirs not to reason why, theirs but to do and die'.
I've heard some of the crew talk about it when we're going up against unfriendly odds. Why do you ask?
Something you said when we discussed HQ's permission to modify our bombers made me think about it, that's all.
I sometimes wonder what this war would be like if the Funayūrei hadn't showed up.
Other than that we wouldn't have met?

Fields.MenuText: Other than that, of course.
And just how different my life would have been then.
More like how the war would have progressed in their absence.

Fields.DialogueText: It would have been worse. Much, much worse.
Thankfully, you'll never know.
I have to assume their destruction will far outpace what would have otherwise been.
Indeed. I wonder how many of us will be left when we come back from the jaws of death and past the mouth of hell.
Too few, Kanchou. Too few. But we can do our part to save more right now.
@BATTLE
Lady Kaga, would you care to join me for a drink?
A drink, Kanchou? We drink all the time.
Not socially, we don't. I'd like to sit down and have a drink with my friend.
Your friend. I like the sound of that.
As do I. We work well together, Lady Kaga, and for all the tumult and hardships we've seen and will see, I think I'll enjoy having you at my side as a friend.
Then to what should we toast, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: To friendship.
To victory.
To dedication.

Fields.DialogueText: To friendship!
To victory!
To dedication!
Then to-
And to raining hell on Morganas. I'll drink to that.
Amagi.
Amagi?
This victory's hers too.
There's plenty to go round.
